00011 class NullTest(BaseTest):
00012     """NullTest does nothing, but serves as an example test.
00013     
00014         It inherits its functionality from BaseTest, and serves as a template for future
00015     tests.  
00016 
00017     Simply copy NullTest.py, and rename the file, and class name, and rewrite TestResults
00018     """
00019     
00020     def __init__(self,potentialname,energy,TestDependencies=[],*args,**kwargs):
00021         #Passes the initialization arguments to the BaseTest initialization
00022         BaseTest.__init__(self,potentialname,energy,TestDependencies,*args,**kwargs)
00023 
00024 
00025     def TestResults(self):
00026         """Required module, the TestResults Module returns a dictionary of result. 
00027         
00028         of the form { 'NameOfValue' : value, 'NameOfSecondValue' : secondvalue }
00029         
00030         This is where your test code goes.  Feel free to write other methods if necessary.
00031         """
00032 
00033         return {}
00034 
00035 
00036     def Verify(self):
00037         """ Optional verify script to be used to generate a visual output for
00038         
00039         quick check that everything is going alright"""
00040         pass
00041             
00042         
00043 #The following ensures that the test can be called from the command line
00044 if __name__ == '__main__':
00045     #Make sure you change the NullTest in the next line.
00046     test = NullTest(args.potential,args.element,verify=args.verify,write=args.write)
00047     #raises BaseTest.main
